sections.title: Introduction (Wide Shot)
sections.content: Welcome back! I’m Jihad Al Sayed, and now that you know what a determinant is, let’s talk about its properties — how row operations affect it, how triangular matrices behave, and how determinant rules make matrix analysis faster.

sections.title: Effect of Row Operations
sections.content:
There are 3 main effects:
1. Swapping rows changes the sign.
2. Multiplying a row by a scalar multiplies the determinant.
3. Adding a multiple of one row to another doesn’t change the determinant.

sections.title: Determinant of Triangular Matrix
sections.math: \text{If A is triangular (upper/lower), } \det(A) = \text{product of diagonal entries}

sections.title: Recap
sections.content: We covered essential properties of determinants — how they respond to row operations, how they behave under multiplication, and what happens with transposes and inverses. These tricks save time and help debug matrix problems fast.
